title: Treks and the city: 25 of Britain's best urban walks
text:
Whether it’s foodie trails or brushing up on cultural history, Natalie Paris and our team of writers have it covered...

There is nothing like a walk to work up an appetite and get you thinking. Yet as the nights draw in and the weather becomes unreliable, bracing country hikes look less and less appealing. Why not plan a walk in a city instead? With something to see around every corner and an array of cafés and pubs to duck into for shelter or a rest, in a couple of hours you can get some exercise and learn a great deal too.

Traditional guided walks are complemented these days by newer walks that focus not on general sightseeing but on other subjects that can reveal much about a city – its...
description: Whether it’s foodie trails or brushing up on cultural history, Natalie Paris and our team of writers have it covered.
